meanings.definition: Intended to ward off evil or harmful influences.
meanings.sent1: The apotropaic amulet protected the wearer from harm.
meanings.sent2: The ancient Greeks believed in the power of apotropaic symbols to keep evil at bay.
meanings.sent3: The apotropaic charm on her necklace made her feel safer walking alone at night.
meanings.sent4: The apotropaic ritual was performed to create a barrier against negative energy.
meanings.sent5: The apotropaic spell was whispered softly, banishing any lurking malevolent spirits.

meanings.definition: Serving to avert or prevent evil.
meanings.sent1: The villagers hung apotropaic herbs above their doors to ward off evil spirits.
meanings.sent2: The apotropaic ritual was believed to keep the town safe from harm.
meanings.sent3: The apotropaic gesture of crossing fingers before the test seemed to bring good luck.
meanings.sent4: The apotropaic talisman glowed with a protective energy, keeping the wearer safe.
meanings.sent5: The apotropaic chant echoed through the forest, dispelling any lurking malevolence.
